A die is rolled. Let E be the event "die shows 4" and F be the event "die shows even number". Are E and F mutually exclusive?,"Yes, they are mutually exclusive","No, they are not mutually exclusive","Cannot be determined","Only if the die is fair",b,c1,probability

If P(A) = 0.5, P(B) = 0.7, P(A _ B) = 0.6, are P(A) and P(B) consistently defined?,"Yes","No","Cannot be determined","Only if A and B are independent",b,c3,probability

Two dice are thrown. Event A: sum > 8. Event B: 2 occurs on either die. Event C: sum  7 and multiple of 3. Which pairs are mutually exclusive?,"A and B","B and C","A and C","None of these",d,c3,probability

Three coins are tossed. Events: A (three heads), B (two heads one tail), C (three tails), D (head on first coin). Which events are mutually exclusive?,"A and B","A and C","B and C","All pairs",b,c2,probability

Three coins are tossed. Events: A (three heads), B (two heads one tail), C (three tails), D (head on first coin). Which are compound events?,"B and D","A and C","Only D","B, C, D",a,c2,probability
For two dice: A (even on first die), B (odd on first die), C (sum  5). What is event A'?,"B","C","A _ B","A _ B",a,c2,probability
For two dice: A (even on first die), B (odd on first die), C (sum  5). Is A = B'?,"Yes","No","Sometimes","Only when C occurs",a,c2,probability
For two dice: A (even on first die), B (odd on first die), C (sum  5). Are A and B mutually exclusive?,"Yes","No","Cannot determine","Only if C occurs",a,c2,probability

For two dice: A (even on first die), B (odd on first die), C (sum  5). Are A and C mutually exclusive?,"Yes","No","Sometimes","Cannot determine",b,c2,probability
For two dice: A (even on first die), B (odd on first die). Are A and B' mutually exclusive?,"Yes","No","Cannot determine","Sometimes",b,c3,probability

What is the relationship for three events A, B, C regarding P(A_B_C)?,"Sum of individual - sum of pairs + triple intersection","Sum of individual probabilities","Product of probabilities","Sum - product of pairs",a,c4,probability
